learning_outcomes.description: Explain and apply the technical and analytical terms used in relation to film and television
Use the language of film and television criticism and analysis in effective written and verbal communication.
Critically analyse films and television programs
Demonstrate an understanding of the industrial and institutional contexts of film and television production and reception.
Apply the skills of film and television analysis to a variety of research problems and critical approaches in screen studies and adjacent disciplines.
Build upon your introduction to and further develop your familiarity with films and television programs of different nations, cultures, and languages.

assessments.due_date:
Week 2 - Week 13

Due in your tutorial each week.
assessments.task_description:
Each week in tutorials, there will be a 5-10 minute writing exercise that must be completed. You are responsible for bringing your own pen or pencil. You will be given a specific prompt for each exercise; these will be related to the lecture, screening or reading, and may ask you to respond to a still image or brief clip presented in tutorial. Feedback will be given informally via peer groups in the tutorial immediately after writing. Tutors will collect the worksheets to record completion of the assessment task.

You will receive two marks for each completed exercise, one mark for a partial answer and zero marks for exercises that are incomplete (whether unsubmitted because of non-attendance, submitted but blank, submitted but not responding to the prompt, illegible, etc.) 

Academic Integrity and AI/MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission is not possible for this piece of assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
For this assessment, you must complete a breakdown of the allocated clip that has been uploaded to Blackboard.

After watching the designated film clip presented in class and posted to Blackboard, you are to break down the scene into its constituent parts, noting and naming stylistic features and techniques. You must also analyse the stylistic choices and the effect they seem designed to have on the audience. Please only discuss aspects of mise-en-scene and cinematography.

Start by pasting a screen grab of each shot into a document. Caption each shot with its number in the sequence (e.g. "Shot 1," "Shot 2," etc.). Below this, separate your observations into "Mise-en-Scene" and "Cinematography". Under these headings, you must list the stylistic features and techniques used in the scene. Please underline or bold-face terms from the course textbook Film Art, and indicate parenthetically the page number of the book where they are defined. You should not quote directly from the book; your task is to identify and describe the concrete uses of these features and techniques rather than to define them. This section should be no longer than 500 words (not including references).

On a separate page, you will write a short analytical discussion (up to 500 words) of the sequence you have annotated, explaining how the techniques you have written about create particular effects in the scene. Your discussion should have a thesis statement.

A task sheet, rubric and exemplars will be made available on Blackboard.

Academic Integrity and AI/MT: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
For this assessment, you must analyse one of the clips specified in lecture and uploaded to Blackboard.

For this assignment, you must write a short essay that analyses the form and style of one of the clips specified in lecture and on Blackboard and presents an argument about how form and style creates a particular effect in the clip. For this essay, you must carefully describe particular aspects of style (e.g.: mise-en-scene, cinematography, editing, sound) AND make a claim about how these aspects function together. What purposes might they serve or what sorts of responses might they cue from the audience? You do NOT and should NOT try to discuss ALL the formal and stylistic aspects of a sequence; just focus on those that seem most salient and help you focus your argument.

You should NOT consult outside sources, but you MUST cite and demonstrate your understanding of the terms and concepts in Film Art. You must also use the referencing and formatting style stipulated in the 17th edition of The Chicago Manual of Style.

Please do NOT include still images in your essay.

A task sheet and rubric will be made available on Blackboard.

Academic Integrity and AI/MT: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
For this assessment, you must answer one of the research questions posed on Blackboard. Additionally, you must closely analyse sequences from two (2) films from the course, and at least one (1) of these films must be from weeks 8-13 of the course. Additional instructions will be available on the task sheet and on Blackboard.

For this assignment, you will choose one of the essay questions posted on Blackboard and write a response to this question in the form of an essay. You will answer the question primarily through close analysis of film form and style (including mise-en-scene, cinematography, sound and editing). Your essay must have a central argument and make a claim about how aspects of form and style function together via a thesis. As we are asking you to look at two films, this argument should also be comparative – you should compare the form and style of one film to the other as part of your argument. You must demonstrate your understanding of the terms and concepts in the course textbook Film Art by including references to the textbook in your essay. You must also use appropriate research to support your argument, using a minimum of two (2) academic sources outside of the course readings. Your referencing and formatting style must adhere to that which is stipulated in the 17th edition of The Chicago Manual of Style.

Please do NOT include still images in your essay.

A task sheet and rubric will be made available on Blackboard.

Academic Integrity and AI/MT: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 2 Tutorial

Please do the reading, watch the screening and view the lecture prior to coming to tutorials. Tutorials are designed to consolidate student's knowledge of film and television concepts from the readings and lecture, and build their analytical skills. Each week there is a graded tutorial writing task, followed by tutorial activities carried out individually, in groups, and as a class.
